title: I am not looking for a thank you, but is it wrong to expect the acknowledgement of receiving a gift? - Quora

response.answer_text: No it is not wrong to expect a thank you however that is all you can do is expect it but if it isn’t given except it and go on. When you give a gift the real joy comes from giving. You may have not gotten a thank you from the person for several reason, maybe she sent you a thank you note and it was lost in the mail. Maybe she was nervous which made her forget or maybe she didn’t like you or didn’t like your gift or maybe she wanted to hurt you, there are many reasons for not getting a thank you from the person. Don’t let it bother you too much think about what type of relationship you have with the person now. I’m sure that you already have a idea why the person did not thank you, if she didn’t send you one in the mail.

It is perfectly ok to expect “ tank you “ for a gift. If you do NOT receive one, count your blessings: you have just found out that the receiver of your gift is an UNGRATEFUL person. - do now YOU need to decide if you want this ungrateful person in your life. Do you?
